questions.question: The power factor angle of a purely inductive circuit is: ?

explanations.a: Incorrect because in a purely inductive circuit, the phase angle cannot be 45 degrees. This would occur in circuits with both resistive and inductive components.
explanations.b: Incorrect, as the phase angle in a purely inductive circuit is not 60 degrees.
explanations.c: Incorrect because 75 degrees is not the phase angle for a purely inductive circuit.
explanations.d: Correct. In a pure inductive circuit, the current lags the voltage by 90 degrees. The power factor is the cosine of this angle. Cos(90) = 0, so the power factor is zero.

questions.question: The power factor of capacitive circuits is:?

explanations.a: Correct. Capacitive circuits have a leading power factor because the current leads the voltage.
explanations.b: Incorrect, as lagging power factors are associated with inductive circuits, not capacitive circuits.
explanations.c: Incorrect, as the power factor of capacitive circuits is always leading.
explanations.d: Incorrect, as the power factor of capacitive circuits cannot be arbitrary; it is always leading.

questions.question: What is the effect of a low power factor on an electrical system?

explanations.a: Correct. A low power factor increases the current required for the same amount of useful power, leading to higher energy losses due to increased resistance in the system.
explanations.b: Incorrect, as a low power factor worsens voltage regulation, not improves it.
explanations.c: Incorrect because a low power factor increases, not reduces, the current flow in the system.
explanations.d: Incorrect, as a low power factor has a significant impact on the efficiency and performance of an electrical system.

questions.question: Which of the following components can improve the power factor of an inductive load?

explanations.a: Incorrect, as a resistor cannot improve the power factor of an inductive load.
explanations.b: Incorrect, as an inductor worsens the power factor by increasing the lagging reactive power.
explanations.c: Correct. A capacitor can counteract the lagging current caused by an inductive load, improving the power factor.
explanations.d: Incorrect, as a transformer does not improve the power factor. It only transfers power.

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating the apparent power (S) in an AC circuit?

explanations.a: Correct. S = P + jQ is the formula for apparent power in rectangular form, where P is the real power and Q is the reactive power.
explanations.b: Correct. S = P / PF relates apparent power (S) to real power (P) and power factor (PF).
explanations.c: Correct. S = V × I is the formula for apparent power in terms of voltage (V) and current (I).
explanations.d: Correct. All the formulas listed define the relationships involving apparent power in different forms.
